newsitem.title: USA: GTE,Lycos in Internet directory pact.
newsitem.headline: GTE,Lycos in Internet directory pact.

text.p: GTE Directories Corp, a unit of GTE Corp, and Lycos Inc on Wednesday said they agreed to integrate their Internet directory services starting in January 1997.
The terms of the deal were not disclosed.
GTE said its SuperPages U.S. Nationwide Directory service would link with Lycos' City Guide service to provide local business anad entertainment information for more than 400 U.S. cities.
The SuperPage site is available on the Internet at (http://superpages.gte.net) and also at Lycos' home page at (http://www.lycos.com).
"I think we have an opportunity to take a technical gain and make it a business gain," said Patrick Marshall, vice president of GTE's new media services unit.
"We're going to see about $1 million unique visitors (to the site) once it becomes available," he said.
He said that SuperPages had 600,000 unique vistors in October.
The company said the integrated sites would allow customers to search for specific businesses.
CMG Information Services Inc owns a majority stake in Lycos.
